photo.description: a pillar on the roof of Jokhang Monastery in Lhasa, Tibet. Jokhang has/was/is/could be one of the most holy temple's in Lhasa as it houses a relic of one of the Tara's who is reputed to have converted the then King of Tibet to Buddhism. Now it is typically full of Han security men and very carefully controlled. Not that this seems to make it any less holy for the Tibetans prostrating themselves outside.

photo.description: 中国 西藏 拉萨 大昭寺 Jokhang Monastery, Lhasa, Tibet, China 《甘珠尔》所述六字真言之功德，有下列十种： （一）去一切鬼魅妖魔等害。（二）除一切寒热痰气等病。（三）救度一切水火刀兵等苦。（四）得一切福德寿命等自在。（五）除一切贪嗔痴慢疑等根本诸烦恼。（六）除一切破戒诸恶。（七）消灭诸障，获得十地五道。（八）念十万遍，能闭三途门。（九）念百万遍，能度六道众。（十）念千万遍以上，决得菩提果，成佛无疑。
photo.tags: ཇོ་ཁང་ jokhangmonastery carlzeiss 大昭寺 lhasa 50mm 拉萨 蔡司 planart50mmf14 day tibet 西藏 china 中国 tibetan 藏区 佛教 buddhism 藏传佛教
photo.title: ཨོཾ་མ་ཎི་པདྨེ་ཧཱུྃ་ / 六字真言

photo.description: The Jokhang (Tibetan: ཇོ་ཁང་; Chinese: 大昭寺), also called the Jokhang Temple or the Jokhang Monastery, is a famous Buddhist temple located on Barkhor Square in Lhasa, Tibet. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jokhang_Temple

photo.title: Jokhang Temple

photo.description: I had to wait for ages for this. The crowds come and go and there was only one bit of pavement in full sun that filled the whole shot. The sun is so strong that the shadow shows the prayer wheel well =)
